about_the_game:
“Chymicalia - Change is Possible!”


So reads the glowing sign outside the suspicious door that just appeared out of nowhere between two boarded-up buildings on the rough side of town.

An ordinary Yorkshire town, like any other... but not for long.

Because Chymicalia is a sentient alchemy shop, roving across the cosmos, trapping one poor soul after another as its unwilling servant.

For the last ten years, that servant has been you.

But now you’re here, back in the town you thought you'd never see again, and maybe somehow, this time, things are going to change.

Make potions! Make friends! Make terrible mistakes!


Chymicalia is an alchemy sim with a choice-driven narrative, where you talk to customers, listen to their troubles and attempt to create a potion that will solve their problems. Or at least, give them different problems.

However, Chymicalia is a sentient shop, with its own sinister agenda for its customers. Keeping everyone satisfied isn't going to be easy.

Is change really possible, in this hopeless town? Can you really help any of these people change their lives?

And even if you do... who’s going to help you change yours?
